dc_description_s: The Clean and Affordable Energy Act of 2008 established that all private buildings over 50 Benchmarking is defined as tracking a building’s energy and water use and using a standard metric to compare the building’s performance against past performance and to its peers nationwide. These comparisons have been shown to drive energy efficiency upgrades and increase occupancy rates and property values. DC has chosen U.S. EPA’s free DDOE is required to publicly disclose the ENERGY STAR® Benchmarking results for each privately owned building that is subject to the benchmarking law For more informationdc.gov/energybenchmarking.
dct_spatial_sm: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
dc_title_s: Private Building Energy and Water Performance Benchmarking: Washington, D.C., 2013
